decision_conditions: The development would, by reason of its scale, bulk and mass, appear incongruous and be unacceptably dominant and visually intrusive feature in the rear garden scene, harmful to the character and appearance of the surrounding area, contrary to the Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document, policy D4 of The London Plan (2021) and Policies 7 and 26 of the Local Plan.

The Council consider that the impact of the development on the amenities of the adjoining properties at Nos. 283 and 287 Carter Drive would be unacceptable by reason of noise disturbance, contrary to Policy 7 of the Local Plan and the Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document.

Statement Required by Article 35 (2) of the Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015: Consideration was given to seeking amendments, but given conflict with adopted planning policy, notification of intended refusal and the reason for it was given to Mr Anwar by email on 21/01/22.

Staff note that the floor and elevation plans do not correlate with site photographs of the development. Specifically, the floor and elevation plans do not show some front and side windows of the outbuilding.
description: Retrospective application to replace existing shed flat roof with pitched roof
